main event: A bright, round object the size of a pea was sighted by a Navy lookout and multiple bridge watch standers for approximately 15 minutes.
interesting points: The object was as bright as a first magnitude star and was a single white object.
The object appeared on a bearing of 242 degrees and an elevation of 8 degrees, passed overhead with no deviation from its course, and disappeared over the horizon on a bearing of 035 degrees.
The object was first sighted at 0225Z and disappeared at 0249Z.
The sighting was confirmed by the commanding officer and five bridge watch standers.
A Bargas aircraft on a bearing of 230 degrees and 65 miles away at the time of the sighting did not sight the object.
sighted object: A bright, round object the size of a pea
witnesses: Navy lookout, commanding officer, and five bridge watch standers
